One man who WALKS UP TO THE CAMERA, eyeing the vanishing car with intense suspicion: COLONEL NELEC. He then looks to the ground in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A FRESH, EMPTY YELLOW SUPER 8 FILM BOX. Nelec st to it, picks it up. Looks at it. Then back up at the disappearing car. We PUSH IN ON HIS BURNING EYES AND --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RRRRRRRROOOOOOOOOAAAAAARRRRRRRR! The Buick speeds past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overlapping mayhem, but Charles obsesses over his camera:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, that was insane! He had a gun! An actual physical gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe all that just happened here! Nothing ever My whole camera lends is like happens here!!! shattered now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My heart is pounding! That train could of killed us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alice nervously drives, she shakes her head: no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, all the glass just fell out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard enough to drive without everyone yelling! 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, keep it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe: what was Woodward talking about? I don't know, I don't know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm never taking a train again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You'll die, your parents will die," guys, that is not good information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, the focus ring just fell off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one cares about your CAMERA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I the only one shaking?! I'm also crying --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't tell anyone we were there - - we can't say a thing about it -- my dad cannot find out I took his car, do you guys hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay-- no one's saying anything. None of us. (to his friends) Guys -- we're not gonna say anything -- are we?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys all muster, "no's." Joe turns sweetly to Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? No one's gonna know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice nods; if not quite relieved, at least grateful for But they all stare off for a long beat... haunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Buick SPEEDS AWAY... 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN as the Buick pulls up. The dusty boys pile out They all kind of look at each other. What a night. Charle who looks at Joe for a beat, holds up his defunct camera the tripod. Joe nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice finds something on the passenger seat and holds it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, this is yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe goes to the window. Alice holds it out: THE CUBE. He takes it with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- oh, thanks,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should never have done this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just drives away. Left there are Joe, Charles, Presto Cary and Martin. They all kind of look at Alice go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe in the bath. The quiet SWISH of water as Joe holds th CUBIC OBJECT. He relives the night: he mouths explosions. Remembers the fear... then he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is STARTLED AWAKE as if from a nightmare; Jack has aw him, quickly bucking his holster, urgent:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta head in early -- -- okay-- Make sure you let Lucy out. -- I will --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back WIDE to see Joe's room -- while in the FOREGROU is his desk, crowded with stuff. In focus, however, is th CUBED OBJECT he took from the crash site. As the shot progresses, you may notice that THE CUBE HAS CHANGED SHAP THE VOLUME IS THE SAME, BUT THE CORNERS HAVE EXTENDED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna -- what, you with Charles today? Yeah, I'll be with Charles-- Make sure you get the yard. -- okay, I will.

dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT: Joe fills Lucy's FOOD DISH with kibble. No do

The CHYR READS, "TRAIN DERAILED - AIR FORCE AIDS CLEAN UP." Joe si beside Charles. They both watch, stunned, as a PHOTO OF D WOODWARD appears on the TV, with the heading "DRIVER OF T

dialogues.text: Can you believe this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the news. That means it's real.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, local science teacher Thomas Woodward is still being treated by Air Force medical personnel after last night's train derailment. Woodward apparently fell asleep at the wheel of his pick-up truck, which was hit by the speeding train at approximately one AM. Eighty-two train cars were thrown from the tracks in the derailment, the largest such accident in Ohio's history. The condition of Woodward, who has taught at Lillian Middle School for the past six years, remains unknown. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both stare at the train crash, stunned. Finally, quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Looks like a disaster movie, doesn't it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we PUSH IN ON CHARLES, going from depressed and lost

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... oh my God, Joe... that's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can use this -- we can film it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts to smile) -- you wanna go back?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to him) --okay-- Holy shit, that's mint. You're a total brain--! We gotta get the camera fixed and the film developed from last night-- I gotta go steal some more money from my mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Charles ride their bikes into town, across a BRID the massive STEEL MILL in the background --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If any of the footage from last night is usable, that means we need Alice to play the wife again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I thought she was good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was mint, but she's never gonna do it.

dialogues.text: I think she will. 37.

dialogues.text: There's no way. You heard what she said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that was before the new pages, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You honestly think she cares about the scenes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT DOWN from the town's WATER TOWER -- Joe and Charles their bikes underneath it, crossing Main Street -- two la MILITARY TRUCKS drive past, we may note the Airman in the passenger seat SCANS THE AREA with a handheld device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, did you hear what she said last night? "I never should have done this!" Dude, she was totally wigged!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she was, we all were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see her face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I saw her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, what's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I think she's going to do it.

dialogues.text: They park their bikes outside OLSEN CAMERA AND HI-FI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The book opens -- Joe's finger goes down -- finds "LOUIS DAINARD" and the phone number. We're in: 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe at the counter, DIALING THE ROTARY PHONE, Charles beh him with DONNY, the 19-year-old, dark-haired, bearded salesman with a big collared button-down shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lens is cracked. Focus ring broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya think it's fixable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: We can use my dad's camera -- it's got sound and-- Hello?

dialogues.text: Alice-- hi, it's Joe. Lamb.

dialogues.text: Hi...

dialogues.text: So we have some new scenes. For the movie. We were hoping you'd be in `em.

dialogues.text: Joe twirls a hanging Kodak "RELIVE THE MEMORIES" SUPER 8 PROMOTIONAL SIGN, speaking in a soft voice:

dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I should go.

dialogues.speaker: JOE ALICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- wait, hold on -- lemme come over and show you the pages, okay? I'll be right there. No, d--

dialogues.text: Lower-lower-middle class house, set against woods. Joe wi Alice at her front door. She seems unnerved:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: You totally did, that's true, I know, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, which-- under normal conditions I would nev--

dialogues.text: It's too weird after last night-- I don't understand how you guys can keep working on your stupid movie, I really don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

During all this:

dialogues.text: -- what?

dialogues.text: He is so sophisticated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, I like coffee. No one likes coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.text: Probably, Smartin.

dialogues.text: Shut up, I don't like that--

dialogues.text: Dr. Woodward had that map. He drove onto the tracks. Maybe there was something-- -- he wanted to destroy, he wanted to destroy? yeah.

dialogues.text: I say he was just sick of being old and wanted to kill himself.

dialogues.text: He had a gun, why not use that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are infinitely more effective ways to commit suicide: pills,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pussy, stop pulling the fries away. I ordered these for a reason. -- he gets all possessive with his fries, it's so annoying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could jump from a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall down stairs.

dialogues.text: Well, that's not really effective. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHHHHJESUS! You heard what the Old Man said, we can't talk about this! (to waitress, with coffee) -- thank you, very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drowning, hari kari, also known as seppuku--?

dialogues.text: Excuse me, could we please get another order of fries because my friend here is fat?

dialogues.text: What was your teacher even talking about? Who are we supposed to be afraid of anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna find out -- guys, we gotta forget we were there. Joe, seriously... you really wanna take a chance that something could happen to your dad, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lands for Joe -- for all of them -- as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive train wreck that goes on for a mile. Hundreds MILITARY work to clean up fast. A truck DRIVES PAST CAMER taking us to Jack and Nelec, who WALK together amid the debris. Choppers land and take off in the background:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I understand, this crash has caused a whole mess of confusion. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can expect, the local authorities are trying to figure out just what happened here as well as how to help you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's under control. It'll be a very fast clean-up.

dialogues.text: That's not going to be possible.

dialogues.text: -- what town is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.text: Jack looks at Nelec -- not quite believing him... 47.

dialogues.text: Jack is with Sheriff Pruitt, who stands, distracted, pick up reports from his desk, on his way out.

dialogues.text: I'd say they have their hands full, wouldn't you?

dialogues.text: Weird little cubes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --yeah, into these red trucks, dozens of these trucks -- and I'm telling you, they're scrambling to get the hell outta there--

dialogues.text: I'd say that's a good thing, wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff, I think you need to go check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think you need a break.

dialogues.text: Jack, I've been telling you this since Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: FINGERS TAPPING -- they're fingers on a COUNTER, a WALKMA sitting beside them. BOOM UP to 23-year-old BREEN, who di the BLONDIE he's listening to. He is alone in the station store. Behind him, 60-year-old SHERIFF PRUITT enters.

dialogues.text: Breen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see we're at the lonely gas station the kids drove pas earlier. Pruitt's SQUAD CAR filling up, the only car here High overhead, a yellow KELVIN sign TURNS atop a tall pol near the road. Pruitt crosses to his car. Peels the candy bar. Hearing something, he turns -- a PACK OF DOGS RUN BY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP of the PUMP'S SPINNING white NUMBER on black; th gallons and dollar amount blurring higher -- then A BIZAR REFLECTION -- Pruitt sees it, turns -- and what he sees i TALL AND TERRIFYING -- he DROPS THE CANDY -- GOES FOR HIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen, eyes closed, blasts his Walkman (we only hear TINN MUSIC) as, through the window behind him, the rear of the squad car SUDDENLY SPRINGS UPWARD VIOLENTLY as if the FRO SECTION WAS SUDDENLY CRUSHED! PRUITT SCREAMS, MUFFLED, as CAR SLAMS back to the pavement -- LIGHTS FLICKER --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas PUMPING onto the asphalt, SCREAMS OF PRUITT, horrible

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRUITT'S SCREAMS END as Breen OPENS HIS EYES AND RIPS off headphones: the hell was that? He looks outside -- sees t car -- shattered windows. Confused, he heads out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen moves tentatively toward the CRUSHED CAR -- quickly glances for Pruitt, who's missing. He gets close to the c confounded by what he sees -- hands shaking, he rights th pump and replaces it. His heart pounds as he starts for t building -- but SLIPS ON THE GAS -- falls hard -- looks u sees whatever's coming for him -- SCREAMS as he gets to h feet and RUNS LIKE A MOTHERFUCKER --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breen RUSHES INSIDE -- we're WITH HIM as behind him: KKKRASH!!!! An EXPLOSION OF GLASS AND JUNK FOOD and -- 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE LOOK DOWN UPON THE STATION FROM UP HIGH -- where the turning, lit KELVIN SIGN BLOCKS OUR VIEW FOR THE MOMENT - can only HEAR THE HORROR happening inside the station unt FINALLY the sign REVEALS THE STATION -- everything inside looks like it's in a BLENDER -- THERE'S A SUPER-HUMAN UPHEAVAL HAPPENING IN THERE -- and Breen's SCREAMS CONTIN as the turning Kelvin sign BLOCKS OUR VIEW AGAIN -- as th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FACE. A MAKE-UP BRUSH APPLYING MAKE-UP. It's ALICE, and she's becoming a ZOMBIE. We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe makes her up -- a not half-bad, simple ZOMBIE MAKE-UP Pale skin, sunken eyes and cheekbones. In the background, other kids prepare to film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a mirror, she gazes into it, sort of amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn how to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mostly the Dick Smith Monster Make- up Handbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. Whatever. Charles is suddenly there, with Cary:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! So I'm gonna need more shots of the train crash, obviously-- you know that train model you made? Can we blow it up and film it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe doesn't want to do this at all. AT ALL. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mint. Gnarly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles and Cary head off, planning the explosions. Alice looks at him knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care, they can blow it up. I can show you the train, it's nothing, it's stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna see it? Later? The... train? My train model? The train I made?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIGHTS IN THE HOUSE DIM -- BROWN OUT -- then back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's like the third time Dude. Bitchen. that's happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how am I supposed to be a zombie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Just be a lifeless ghoul. Someone with no soul, dead eyes. Scary. D'you ever have Mrs. Mullin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For English? Yeah--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- like her. But hungry, like hungry for human flesh. To make them turn into zombies, because that's what zombies do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice considers this -- then, after a beat, starts doing best zombie. Joe smiles, `cause it's pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. That's really good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Alice slowly leans in toward him -- is this performan Or is this something else--? And she PUTS HER MOUTH ON HI NECK IN A FAKE BITE, which makes Joe go still -- a shiver down his spine -- he's never felt anything like this in h life. And when she pulls back, her performance over, she' smiling. He doesn't know what to say, tries to stay cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're NEAR THE GAS PUMPS, LOW TO THE GROUND -- DOLLY as J EDIE and MR. BLAKELY come out here. We pass SMALL SHATTER PIECES OF RED AND BLUE PLASTIC and STOP AND RACK to the G Sheriff Pruitt dropped. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Careful, there was a gas spill. I don't even know how much fuel I've lost.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BLAKELY
dialogues.text: -- You don't seem to be asking a lot of questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Give this man some time, Mr. Blakely.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BLAKELY
dialogues.text: He's just the Deputy, he's not the Sheriff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack kneels by the Smith and Wesson Model 19. Jack pulls a handkerchief, lifts the fun -- PUSH IN ON the engraved initials "H.P." JACK IS ROCKED BY THIS. He opens the cyli to check if it had been fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT BACK WIDE. No squad car here. Jack checks out the bro BLUE AND RED PLASTIC as he makes a walkie call:

dialogues.speaker: MR. BLAKELY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think this is most likely a bear attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when I said you talk too much? Well, this is the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky, ya heard from Sheriff Pruitt this morning?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Negative, still no word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky, I need you to have Dayton send a CS unit out to Edie's. You put out an APB on the Sheriff and Breen Haskell -- send units to their houses immediately. You copy all of that?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... copy. And Jack, we're getting a lot of unusual calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... what kind of unusual calls...? 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry IZZY, 65, OPENS A NEW CAR HOOD: PIECES OF THE ENGIN RIPPED AWAY, MESSY -- DOLLY WITH HIM, Jack follows:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never seen this kinda thing before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Izzy opens ANOTHER CAR HOOD: PIECES MISSING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell am I supposed to do? Insurance company thought I was joking with him. Look at my Bonneville here-- look at this. I got a call about this car yesterday. What am I going to tell the customer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having trouble with anyone lately, Izzy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking, you should talk to Louis Dainard. I didn't help him out with financing last year, wouldn't be surprised if this was-- some sorta sick retribution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jack heads back to his car, THREE RESIDENTS move to hi walk with him, AD LIB:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Some strange shit has been -- d'you call the station going on. My antenna's gone-- yet. You need to call the our dog is gone, he hasn't station. And file a report, come home this morning -- before anything can be done Jack, my lights keep going on about it. And then we can and off. Counting on you, take care of these things. If Jack. you do that for me, I promise you, I'll handle it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems to have appeased them -- but as he turns, we see stressed he is. He stops, noticing FOUR MILITARY TRUCKS DRIVING PAST, SLOWLY, ANTENNAS atop the trucks, and the m inside seemingly scanning the area. Jack is disturbed by this. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe rides along a hillside. Parks his bike. Walks toward edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy. Lucy. Lucy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops to reveal the town of Lillian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe rides the street, calling out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy! ... Lucy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT as he DIPS down a neighborhood hill, sun LOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A community CORKBOARD. Joe posts up a piece of paper; we IT NOW IN CLOSE-UP. It's a MISSING DOG SIGN FOR LUCY. We' on Joe's face as he finishes pinning it up -- when someth he sees makes him stop. He slowly takes a step back. Then another... his eyes glued to the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we see the REVERSE -- SLOWLY PULLING BACK -- REVEALI

dialogues.speaker: THAT THERE ARE DOZENS AND DOZENS OF BRAND NEW "DOG MISSIN
dialogues.text: SIGNS POSTED ON THE BOARD. It's COVERED in them. Joe is s stunned, he doesn't notice the MILITARY TRUCKS that pass the background behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-BAM: back door opens, Joe enters. EMPTY PIZZA BOX on t table. Jack and four POLICE OFFICERS in the living room, smoking, reviewing POLICE REPORTS, marking MAPS, taking n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need more help around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got four men on the Pruitt case alone. We've called into Dayton, they'll be out in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not enough. People don't feel safe here -- and you know why? `Cause they're not--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officers agree. Joe moves into the doorway where his and other convene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the Air Force isn't answering a damn question: they've got trucks at Woodward's house, looking for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got trucks all over town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a guy riding shotgun in one of those trucks -- had some kind of scanner in his hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --like a Geiger counter or

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. They're saying it's just clean-up at the train crash, but they're taking molds of tire tracks. Which means they're looking for someone-- now what's that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe has heard this and DROPPED HIS FLASHLIGHT -- the men turn, silent. Joe, on the spot:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- have you... seen Lucy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure she's around. I put a couple of slices in the fridge for you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- oh-- I ate those. Sorry, Kid--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... okay, I'll find a--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the POWER GOES OUT -- the men react -- it FLICKERS O AND OFF -- Jack grabs his radio a the POWER RETURNS: 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky, you got power at the station?

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: On and off. Brook County's in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get water and power out there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe paints his model on the floor of his living room, watching In Search Of and talking to Charles on his walki talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the Air Force is looking for a car -- Alice's dad's car -- they're taking tire prints from the crash site. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna hear about it. They could be monitoring us right now! Jesus, shut up. Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the military's at Woodward's house. Looking for his research. Whatever that means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe -- YOU CAN NOT FLAKE OUT ON ME AND BE A DICK! Are you gonna come help me tomorrow or not? I need you to make Alice a zombie again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Joe tries to snap himself out of it. But is disturbed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I'll do the make-up. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT: middle of nowhere wooded area as an OHIO POWER CHERRY PICKER TRUCK drives up, parks beside a UTILITY POL 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROONEY, 49. Cigarette in his mouth, makes notes on a weathered clipboard. Glances at the power line. Doesn't understand what he sees -- PUSH IN ON HIM. He radios in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Rooney at Mary-10, was there re-routing on this line?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Negative, but the grid through Liberty is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... yeah, `cause there's no overhead lines on these poles.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- come again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No power, no comm cables. Stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He DRIVES AGAIN -- we see a WIDE SHOT OF THE LANDSCAPE -- HALF A DOZEN UTILITY POLES -- ALL BARE -- NOT ONE WIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck comes to a stop, roadside. Tall trees and a SAL YARD behind them. PUSH IN ON ROONEY who calls in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got over a half mile of copper missing.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- that-- doesn't sound possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lines are back up at M-38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cherry picker bucket, Rooney works the controls. H begins LIFTING; a WIDE SHOT shows him rising to the bare utility pole STEPDOWN TRANSFORMER. When Rooney finally ge to the top, with gloves hands, he inspects the transforme After a moment, though, he stops. HEARS something else, p the sound of electricity. He looks over toward the SALVAG YARD. Except it's mostly hidden by the trees. From here, Rooney can only see the tops of the JUNK PILES. A small METALLIC CRASH. Then ANOTHER. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney cranes his neck to get a view. Another METALLIC CR this time GLASS BREAKING, too. Then, in the distance, at middle of the salvage yard, SOMETHING FLIES INTO THE AIR, FALLING AND LANDING WITH A CLANG-THUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney strains his eyes to see -- what the hell was that? tin can? A piece of a fender? Hard to tell from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, thrown into the air: A CAR TIRE. It lands with a TH Rooney then uses the bucket controls -- MOVES BACKWARD AN -- a touch higher toward the transformer -- not exactly watching how close he is getting. He stops. Watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ENTIRE JUNKED MOTORCYCLE flies into the air, discarded twirling, and CRASH LANDS, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney is stunned. As the METALLIC RUMMAGING SOUNDS CONTI Rooney moves the bucket EVEN HIGHER -- when suddenly his bucket BEEP-BEEPS LOUDLY -- a warning he's too high -- an suddenly stops it and the BEEPING STOPS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But so do the rummaging sounds. SILENCE, save for the eer HUM OF POWER. He waits. Nothing. Wants a better view, so begins to LOWER THE BUCKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a WIDE SHOT, seeing his DESCEND, PAINFULLY SLOWL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we're in a LONG LENS CLOSE UP of Rooney as he SLOWLY DROPS -- TIGHT ON HIM as he's looking over toward the sal yard -- and it takes us a minute to realize there's fucki

dialogues.speaker: CHERRY PICKER, ROCKING BACK AND FORTH IN INCREASINGLY SMA
dialogues.text: MOVEMENTS, UNTIL THE TRUCK IS MOTIONLESS. Empty. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then: NOISE -- and an AMPLIFIED VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BABBIT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wanna know who took `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOUD TOWN MEETING. Two-hundred frustrated CITIZENS crow the auditorium. Jack at the podium, TOWN OFFICIALS, inclu the local MAYOR sit on stage as well. Currently, MRS. BAB 52, speaks into the microphone on the floor: 59.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BABBIT
dialogues.text: Twenty microwave ovens: gone from my inventory. Brook County's without power -- this feels to me like a Russian invasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town ROARS its approval -- Jack, impotent, tries:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Babbit, I don't believe the Russians have anything to do with what's happening in town-- but I'm calling the curfew because w--

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BABBIT
dialogues.text: Until you can tell me who's messing with us, I say it's the Soviets and we're at war. I like you, Jack, but we need Sheriff Pruitt back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town ERUPTS in agreement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have good people working on that. Mr. McCandless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short, bald man of 65, MR. MCCANDLESS speaks:

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCCANDLESS
dialogues.text: Since Wednesday morning, my Ham radio's been a mess -- all sorts of frequencies I like to scan. Some kind of buzz modulation-- have you found that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McCandless, can I speak with you for a moment, privately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor takes over as Jack has a SIDEBAR MEETING with M

dialogues.speaker: MR. MCCANDLESS JACK
dialogues.text: -- it was like having my -- that must be very annoying- radio hi-jacked-- - you don't know the frequencies off-hand, do you? -- sure I do: 13201 to 13710, (pulls out paper, pen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack hurries from the town meeting to the station --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, all the tools in the garage are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patty, get in touch with Vicky. David, have you seen Milner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, I haven't seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a sink hole in my garage. It almost sank a foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Tom. Tom, have you seen Milner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you tried his office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The powers been out for days

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack continues, into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY FAST with an exasperated Jack as he WRITES, tailed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Rosko, I need you to get every radio we have and you tune to these frequencies -- understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Danny, you have a radio scanner with a descrambler don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voice inverter, yeah. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, get it down and set it up for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the Air Force is using

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for his office, seeing LOUIS, who is being escor out by an Officer across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- he was at my house yesterday morning, are you aware of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet to Jack) We brought him in about the car lot and other things -- he's clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd appreciate it if you would inform your son that my house if off-limits. And so it my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis heads out -- HOLD ON JACK AS he turns, ENTERS HIS OFFICE, and as that door opens, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens of his messy, motherless room. Joe and Ali enter. He could not be more self-conscious. He moves stac of comic, tosses some dirty clothes behind the bed -- pai underwear and socks. He closes the closet and hangs a bat towel on his desk chair. She looks around sa she enters. light dim, intimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh gawd, I didn't clean up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe quickly moves a pile of papers and books from the des the floor; NOTEBOOKS AND SCHOOL WORK spill out and we get GLIMPSE of some "B-MINUSES" and other "C-PLUSES" in RED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, embarrassed, hides them, then moves to his MODELS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you made all these? 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's the Hunchback of Notre Dame. I watched that one on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice sits on the bed. Joe takes the FIVE-CAR TRAIN MODEL She moves close:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the train they wanna destroy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice hold it. Joe watches her. She really looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it looks real. (beat, studies) It looks so old...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's dry brush technique. (off her look) After you've painted the base color, you take something like... (grabs up Testors bottle) Euro Gray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face is so close to his. Her hair touches his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Euro Gray...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are so many different grays, it's crazy. And you pour a little onto like a paper plate. Then you take a dry brush and you just dip it in, then you brush on the paper, so the paint's barely on the brush. Then you make small brush strokes on the model. Little ones, like where the wear and tear would be. Around the wheels. Or where the doors would slide. Then you do it again, like with Camouflage Gray-- or here, I used Insignia Red to make it look like there was another coat of paint on there before. Like they painted over it, but you could see it scratched off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost in thought, he looks at her. Suddenly self-conscious 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that necklace? (off his awkward stare) The one you were holding at the train crash. Was it your mom's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes him a beat. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad gave it to her the day I was born. She wears it all the time. Used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was bad, how she-- died and stuff, but they got the necklace back. So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their tension INTERRUPTED BY an out of breath Charles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, what the hell?! No one knew where you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sitting right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be the soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were calling Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan blew us off, he's a pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta do it. You're the only one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack with OFFICER TALLY (24):

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell do you mean you "found my dog in Brookville?" That's a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy-- that's where she is. We've gotten nearly thirty calls from people who have found local dogs. Thing is, the calls coming in aren't local.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tally puts a MAP on his desk -- 28 DOTS in a CIRCLE, anyw from a 20 to 150 MILE RADIUS, WITH LILLIAN AT THE CENTER.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER TALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's like they all just... ran away, every direction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Rosko at his desk, with a YOUNG WOMAN, a HAM RADI his desk beside a REEL-TO-REEL TAPE DECK. He takes notes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not her. She never's disappeared before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Now what does she look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got dark hair, it was in rollers. Do you know what rollers are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know what rollers are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went to her car--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a GARBLED ELECTRONIC SOUND from the HAM RADIO. R quickly hits RECORD on the reel-to-reel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs speaker, turns the volume knob, puts the speaker close to the tape recorder, turns on recorder. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR OFFICERS gather as Jack PLAYS BACK THE REEL-TO-REEL through Milner's DESCRAMBLER. He WRITES DOWN AS THEY LIST TO MEN'S VOICES, creepily FILTERED and BROKEN UP:

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --zero-niner center opera - (AD LIB) ocal position-- fangs out. Listen, that's Air Force. Cop-- confirm, Operation What are they doing Walking Distance is-- six- transmitting on these three-niner, retur-- frequencies? Maybe they don't erations. want anyone to find em? Maybe they're not Air Force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he say? Operation what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking Distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILITARY VEHICLES parked everywhere. Personnel removing b from the house, packing it all up. But out front, Joe is dressed as an Airman, performing with Martin, dressed as detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Military trucks surround the house. Hathaway is with a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came as soon as I could, what's happening here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Military police investigation. It was a suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suicide? Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A former Air Force officer. He called me last night, said he had a secret that he couldn't keep any longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Joe hands Hathaway a FILE. Hathaway looks at it. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He worked at Romero Chemical. He found out some things the company's been doing. After what you told me at the bar, I thought you should know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary behind the camera, Charles beside him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we gonna get in trouble here--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh! Production value! It's for the movie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This proves it. They knew, the company knew. Thank you so much for the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just made the discovery ourselves. You understand this is top secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never have given you this information if you and I hadn't served together in Vietnam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it continues, we see Alice behind the camera, watching Joe, smiling. But then she sees something that disturbs h Jack's CRUISER pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen OFFICERS go through HUNDREDS OF CARDBOARD BOXES o documents. Books and personal belongings are put into box taken from the house. Overmyer enters, crosses to Nelec, reviews a folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing so far-- 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much more is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty boxes in the basement, maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, more tax returns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here somewhere. If we can't find it, Woodward'll tell us where it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Nelec has seen something outside: THE KIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the hell's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... looks like kids making a movie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, a WINDOW, showing the street, where Jack ins Joe get into the car. Nelec looks out -- sees Jack take J by the arm, grab the tripod and head to his squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jack gets out, he sees the kids and isn't happy. He mo toward Joe and his friends:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Lamb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe spins around as Jack arrives, grabs his camera from Charles and saying firmly, to Joe:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is stunned -- instantly humiliated in front of Alice he's taken back to the squad car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-- Mr. Lamb? That's your camera, but technically, that's my film-- 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack OPENS the car's back door -- Joe gets in -- Jack SLA it shut, then throws the camera and tripod into the passe seat and SLAMS that door, heading to the house, leaving J in the back. Nelec heads outside -- Jack moves to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to help you out deputy. I really would. But we operate on a need to know basis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are your trucks sweeping the town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be out of your way shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm sure you wouldn't mind me contacting DC. Talk to some friends about "Walking Distance."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lands on Nelec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. We'll do it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk. Just not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stops, turns to uncomfortable Nelec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, his breathing heavying, sits in the car, heart pound watching his father move over to talk to Nelec, close aga Then he looks over at his friends -- Charles giving him a "WHAT THE FUCK?!" Look. Alice watches him sympathetically She mouths to him a guilty, "...is it me...?" And Joe sha his head: "No." But we -- and she -- know better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad car pulls up. Jack gets out, Joe follows -- THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door opens. Jack enters, then lets Joe pass him. Joe clos the door hard and says, angrily, but restrained:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is new. All this. For the both of us. Dealing with-- all this, just us. So I'm going to make this as clear and simple as I can: You're not friends with Alice Dainard. When I say no, I don't mean maybe. I don't mean yes. I mean no. I've known Louis Dainard for alotta years-- he's been nothing but trouble. Your mother used to say he's not a bad guy, he just needs a chance, he's just sad - - well I tried to be good to him, but I can't. Not anymore. I will not allow him or his daughter in this house. I will not allow you spending time with her, doing projects or whatever it is that you're doing. THAT'S IT. I hope we're clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack turns to leave -- but Joe, enraged, says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack stops -- stunned -- Joe's heart pounds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not clear. You and I aren't clear about anything. We couldn't be less clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph Francis Lamb--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just `cause mom died doesn't mean you know anything about me!!! You don't. You don't know about Alice either -- she's kind! 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not having this discussion with you--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's NICE to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what she is! Her father is a selfish, irresponsible son-of-a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack moves CLOSE to Joe -- intimidating -- Joe steps back Jack is fucking intense:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You listen to me, I've got twelve thousand people in this town that are scared out of their minds-- they've got one person they can rely on -- it used to be someone else, but now it's just me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack suddenly stops himself, realizing what he's saying. to whom he's saying it. But somehow, in this moment, he c be a better father than law officer. Not yet. More upset himself than Joe, he heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe rides UP A HILL -- BOOM UP -- REVEAL THE TOWN CEMETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe sits, his back against his mother's grave. Holds her LOCKET, staring at it. He's just come here for comfort. B then -- a SOUND -- and Joe turns. Deep and low, in the distance. Joe is motionless. HEARS IT AGAIN. He stands, p out his flashlight -- aims the beam down ROWS OF GRAVES, toward the big CARETAKER'S SHED in the distance. Another INTENSE, LOW SOUND -- then a high pitch HIT, like METAL O WOOD and Joe backs up, nervous. Another odd sound -- then ANOTHER -- which TRANSITIONS US TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's squad car arrives at the abandoned airfield. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's car pulls up. He gets out of the car. Suddenly the three large MILITARY TRUCKS' HEADLIGHTS COME ON -- all ai at Jack -- he is blinded -- tries to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now BODIES are seen of SOLDIERS, holding and aiming WEAPONS. Then, a VOICE over a TRUCK PA:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Drop your weapons. Put your hands on the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I'm here to see Colonel Nelec. He told me to meet him here.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're under military arrest. Drop your weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON NELEC. Past an IV and medical machinery. He's looking at someone we don't yet see. In the background, Overmyer stands, watching. Nelec is quiet, simple:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want any more trouble. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we see who he's talking to. IT'S DR. WOODWARD. Batter and scraped, he lies in a medical bed, afraid, but defian

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been going through your belongings, looking for evidence. Of what you knew, how you knew it... and who else might know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember you. In the lab. And I recall we didn't see eye to eye, but that's no excuse for doing what you did here. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Woodward swallows. Feels that his time on Earth is co to an end no matter what he does here. By the door, Overm is quietly putting on his BLACK GLOVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So in the spirit of moving forward and avoiding more trouble, tell us where you put your research. I know you had someone document the crash that night. Tell me who that was and I'll help you, I swear to God. On my mother's life -- if you help us now, we will take care of you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WOODWARD
dialogues.text: I've seen what happens, Mr. Nelec, when you take care of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I'm going to bait him. I'm going to catch him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WOODWARD
dialogues.text: He's in me, you know. As I am in him. So when you see him next, as I'm sure you will... I'll be watching you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nelec offers a vague, searching smile. But Woodward will - not ever -- relent. So. Nelec moves to the door, he rem FACING CAMERA, his back to Woodward, as Overmyer moves to bed. PUSH IN ON NELEC'S FACE, UNDERSTANDING HIS TRUE NATU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe sleeps, power still out. Then, a KNOCK. He wakes up. Another KNOCK. His window. He moves to it. Opens it. It's Alice. Joe is half asleep, but also stunned. Very quietly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- are you-- were you sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before, earlier, b-- no, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you wanna come in? 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Alice climbs in. Joe sits on the floor. Alice does to It's odd and silent for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power's still out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room's still messy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in bed, couldn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking. I wanted to tell you something, before tomorrow -- Don't let Charles blow up your train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stares, amazed at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's right, do you? I know he's your friend, but he's so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can be sorta li-- I've known him since Kindergarten, though--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shouldn't always get what he wants. I mean, who always gets what they want? -- I know I don't know you at all. Even though... it sort of feels like I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you not... feel like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no, I totally do, I'm just... sort of in shock at this whole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the POWER RETURNS -- Joe's CLOCK LIGHT goes on behind -- but more chilling, the PROJECTOR comes back on; the SI HOME MOVIE OF HIS MOTHER PLAYS. Joe crawls to the project to stop it -- but:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no, keep it-- please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice moves closer to the screen. Joe sits behind her. Sh watches the film. Can't take her eyes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is that her? 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as Alice watches, we GENTLY PUSH IN... as tears start fill her eyes. Behind her, at a near WHISPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it's so weird watching her like this, like she's still here... (beat, lost in it) ... she used to look at me, this way... like really look. And I just... knew I was there. That I existed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear drops down Alice's face, though Joe can't see that Finally, quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drank that morning. My dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He missed his shift. (beat, hard) Your mom took it for him. The day of the accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching his mother, Joe is quietly stunned. Finally, eye wet, Alice turns to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I know he wishes it was him. Instead of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and sometimes I wish it was, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe just stares at her... heartsick and speechless. Final

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, the SUPER 8 movie ENDS: the film FLIPFLIPFLIPS Joe turns off the projector -- but a SOUND REMAINS. A sor SHUDDER-HUM. Joe unplugs the projector, but the sound remains. Then they look: THE SHUDDERING IS COMING FROM TH CUBE HE TOOK FROM THE CRASH SITE, sitting on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Alice move to it. He turns on his desk lamp. The VIBRATES, almost imperceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- has this--? -- no. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe opens a drawer, grabs a paintbrush -- he touches the -- the thing SHUDDERS ON ITS OWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are amazed. They get LOW -- eyes at desk level -- th SHUDDERING INCREASES IN PITCH AND VOLUME -- he reaches ou touch it with his finger, but suddenly the cube BULLETS A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE-INCH HOLE IN THE WALL! She screams -- they both fall the floor, STUNNED -- PUSH IN ON Joe, his heart pounding. moves to the wall -- looks through the hole: in the dista trees and the TOWN WATER TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice enters the dark house quietly. She steps carefully toward her room, when --

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice makes her JUMP. She turns: sitting in the dark, an armchair, is her father. He's awake. And drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna tell me where you were? Or you want me to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense beat, her mind races. Breathe, Alice, just breath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna talk to you. I said sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go. Be just like your mother and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kills her -- but she does: she leaves the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, crying, gets on her bike and rides off -- a DISTAN FIERY GLOW past the factory and over the hills. The front door opens -- Louis comes out and yells, miserable:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's far gone -- Louis' mind races -- he runs to his BUICK -- starts it up -- PULLS OUT FAST and goes after he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice PEDALS HARD, she wants to escape everywhere. No car the street, no people. A block behind her, SCREECH: a CAR turns onto the road. Her father's car -- she makes a turn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're with Louis as he drive -- clearly drunk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice makes a daring stop -- turns back up the hill, peda hard, crying and hyperventilating --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis sees her, tries to stop, but can't -- and his car S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice GASPS -- stops pedaling -- looks back at her father car, wide-eyed and terrified -- should she go back?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis is bleeding. Badly hurt. He adjusts himself -- painfully -- then looks into the CRACKED-GLASS REAR VIEW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alive is still looking back at the car -- SO SHE DOESN'T THE SHAPE THAT IS COMING BEHIND HER -- and just as she decides: I'M NOT GOING BACK, she turns to begin riding on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis tries to get out of the car -- but it's painful -- his door is JAMMED SHUT -- he goes for the passenger door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- when Louis finally gets out -- he runs from his car -- stumbling drunk and bleeding -- SCREAMING, SHREDDING HIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But all that's there is her bike -- and before he can eve get that far, Louis FALLS HARD onto the pavement, crying, drunken, horrified, shocked, battered MESS. In a WIDE SHO LOUIS is in the middle of the street, Alice's fallen bike the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the great distance, the WATER TOWER. We BOOM DOWN in a MASSIVE WIDE SHOT of a field at night. Then a LONG LENS S of SIX SOLDIERS standing in the field. But ONE stands out front, wearing a FLAME THROWER. And suddenly the quiet is broken by the ROAR OF FLAME. A WIDE, WIDE OVERHEAD SHOT a the flames ARC in the tall, dry grass. Over the radio:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firelight is 0500 hours. Operation Walking Distance is in effect. T- minus four hours until evacuation. Evacuation is T-minus four hours. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distant factory, the even more distant mountains, and ominous PLUME OF SMOKE -- a far-off SIREN is HEARD. Then:

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Why are you not reacting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stands at the counter with Charles, who is in a bad m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing went through my wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to pick it up in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you so angry about? That I'm not going to let you blow up my train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's part of it! Juts a part!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny's returned with a DEVELOPED FILM ENVELOPE. A red "R stamp on it. He gives Charles his change:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tall your sister Donny from Olsen's broke up with Karen, that shit ended a week ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles heads off -- Joe follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Charles rides off with the film, Joe follows -- and we BOOM UP along the WATER TOWER as they go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My whole movie's a disaster `cause of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, my dad's being a turkey. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still gonna finish your movie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Of course it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we CONTINUE BOOMING UP, we arrive at the top of the WA TOWER, where THE CUBE HAS AFFIXED ITSELF TO THE SIDE -- unseen from the street. In the distance, THE THREATENING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Joe and Charles ride their bikes up to his house:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the camera back, I know where my dad put it -- We can still make the festival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you don't even get it do you? It's obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's obvious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gawd, you're a dumb ass. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated beyond belief, Charles goes inside. Joe follow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles threads the film into the projector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night of the crash, you started getting all weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Mr. Attitude all of a sudden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your movie was over! That's what you said! You were upset. I gave you a camera! I helped you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pretend like you did it for me! You didn't do it for me and you know it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles ROLLS THE FILM, DIMS THE LIGHTS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was never about me! It was always about Alice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly on the poster board pinned to the closet, th she is: ALICE, from the night of the train crash. The sce plays as they filmed it:

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HATHAWAY
dialogues.text: John. I don't like it. This case. These murders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do, go to Michigan with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FILMED SCENE CONTINUES as Joe and Charles argue:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're the one who wanted the wife in the movie! 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so you could fall in love with her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's mind spins -- how does he respond to this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you even care what I think about Alice?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I like her! That's why! That's why I asked her in the first place! So I could get to know her, not YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- wait, you like Alice Dainard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Charles' movie) Guys, look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch for a moment as the TRAIN CRASH HAPPENS -- but it's SO SUDDEN, SO FAST, the camera picks up almost nothi Within a moment, the camera is on its side, filming the SETTLING DEBRIS. Charles moves forward, so the film is no partially BEING PROJECTED ON HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIT! Look at all that smoke! We can't use any of this. And you won't even let me blow up your train. Everything's bogus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can make another train and blow that one up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe moves forward. Part of the film PROJECTED ON HIM, too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do like her. Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not even what bothers me. (beat, finally, sad) It's that she likes you too. That really bothers me. I dunno... 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Joe has seen something -- on the screen -- SOTTO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Charles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's stupid. What would she ever like me? I haven't leaned out yet, which the doctor says is gonna

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Joe has slapped Charles' arm, his eyes locked to the screen -- Charles looks too -- AND NOW WE SEE IT: through

dialogues.speaker: BROKEN CAMERA LENS
dialogues.text: FROM THE TRAIN CAR, THROUGH THE WRECKAGE -- what the hell it? TOO DAMN BIG -- MOSTLY OUT OF FRAME, ITS SHAPE AND FL TOO BIZARRE -- we only see the LEGS as it clears frame --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Joe, what the hell--?!

dialogues.speaker: PUSH IN ON THEIR FACES AS THEY SEE THE ALIEN THEY'VE CAPT
dialogues.text: ON FILM -- then from outside: AN AIR RAID SIREN RAMPS, WHINING THROUGH THE TOWN. The boys look at each other -- afraid. QUICK CLOSE-UPS as they REWIND THE FILM AND RIP I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT of the neighborhood -- in the distance: MILITAR TRUCKS, JEEPS AND BUSES drive. NEIGHBORS coming from thei homes in the MID-GROUND: confusion and talk, more VEHICLE Finally, as we BOOM DOWN, RACK TO JOE AND CHARLES, trying make sense of this -- Joe calls to a passing adult, MR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Harkin. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: MR. HARKIN
dialogues.text: Evacuation! The fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Harkin POINTS -- Joe turns to look -- we PAN: THE DIS SMOKE, BIG AND LOOMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: PA VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: -- Due to a wildfire that is raging out of control and threatening to reach the Lillian Chemical Plant--

dialogues.text: Other people in a panic, running to find others who are l A LITTLE GIRL CRIES amid the madness.

dialogues.speaker: PA VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- an evacuation has been called for your safety. Please remain calm and as you board the bus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Charles get on, frightened and uncomfortable. The sit. Outside: the madness of the evac -- they scan the cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see your family anywhere? -- no, you see your dad? -- no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The evacuation BUSES drive through Main Street -- passing soldiers who are MOVING IN THE RED CARGO TRUCKS that we m recognize from the train crash site: THE CONTENTS FROM TH TRAIN ARE BEING MOVED INTO THE CENTER OF TOWN.

dialogues.text: SUPER WIDE SHOT as an ENDLESS LINE OF BUSES, CARS and TRU makes its way from Lillian to...

Those who drove themselves PARK THEIR CARS -- and are ushered to the hang DONNY steps out of his 1972 PONTIAC CATALINA, carrying a duffel. RACK FOCUS to see we're IN THE BUS with Joe, who seen Donny -- and they drive INSIDE THE HANGAR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARMED Air Force and National Guard SOLDIERS direct MASSES PEOPLE, carrying luggage and belongings. Move with Joe an Charles, who scan for familiar faces -- suddenly Charles' MOTHER IS THERE -- embraces Charles: 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles, Charles -- sweetheart, are you okay? I went back to the house and you were gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They made us get on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna find my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna tell him about that thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back if you can't find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads off. ORDERS are being BARKED -- RESIDENTS can be heard, complaining and arguing. Walkie SQUAWKS and PA ANNOUNCEMENTS as SOLDIERS check their wrist bands. Joe pa an ARGUING MAN and SOLDIER:

dialogues.speaker: ARGUING MAN ARGUING SOLDIER
dialogues.text: -- I need to go back to my -- sir, the town is sealed house, I left some medication off -- no one is allowed ba that my wife needs-- -- you can talk to the nurses -- no, we can't get it here -- the town must stay anywhere else, I need to go empty until we've been given back-- the all-clear--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM UP TO REVEAL the EVAC CENTER. A THOUSAND PEOPLE so f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUIS lies in a cot in the TRIAGE UNIT, fifty beds transferred from the hospital. Louis stares off, head bandaged, eyes open, MUTTERING TO HIMSELF, like a man as tired, hung over, injured and in shock as he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Joe, who is looking everywhere for his dad -- he fin sees Louis and hurries to him. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dainard, it's Joe Lamb. I know you don't like me sir, and I'm sorry about that-- but I'm looking for my dad--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Louis GRABS HIS SHIRT and pulls him close. In a voice desperate and heartsick, he says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long beat, sotto) ... what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took her. I saw it. It was... something... so... big, like nothing -- it was-- and no one... no one believes me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... no one believes me-- they just keep giving me pills. It took her... Joe, it took Alice... no one believes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's mind is on fire as he absorbs this -- HE WHISPERS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Louis looks at him with hope --

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It took Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO JOE WITH HIS FRIENDS, assembled around a set of co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing took her--?! -- are you shitting me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, WE HAVE TO GO BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at him like he's from Uranus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back where? To do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to town -- to find Alice -- we have to find her-- 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead, if it took her, she-- -- don't say that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute -- first of all, I want to live. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going whether you come or not-- which I really hope you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pats his backpack) I've got six tons of explosives in here, let's find that thing and blow it to shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen, Charles' hot sister, lies on her cot making her Colu House Records choices. Charles is in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if I'm gonna help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do this for me and I'll babysit the twins next week so you can go to Wendy's stupid party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen suddenly closes her magazine, stares at him suspiciou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not shitting you. You can't ask me any questions though. You can't tell anyone. I'm serious. No one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... does it have to be him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no, you ugly freak. I'm about to rescind the offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen looks RIGHT AS US, vulnerable, but seductive: 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole evacuation thing's freaking me out. Making me rethink my priorities. Saw you over here and thought maybe we could kick back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we see Donny, looking RIGHT AT US. Utterly stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we totally could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked Charles about you, and he said you're a great guy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I totally am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you hate me if I start our relationship by asking a favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING PAST as Donny moves through PARKED CARS, Joe, Char Cary and Martin keeping up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there are rules to being in my car, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are we going anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to the school to open the trailer Woodward had in the parking lot. I bet that's where he keeps his research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys duck as SOLDIERS pass by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What research?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna learn everything we can about that thing so we can find it. And that's how we're gonna save Alice. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorks: no shoes on the upholstery and no one touches the CB, gottit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did this one get so bossy?

dialogues.text: A small, tiled room, no windows. Jack, up all night and pissed off, but bored being pissed off, POUNDS ON THE DOO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Jack is led down a dilapidated, narrow hall. Soldier with semi-auto behind him, aimed at his back. As Jack passes a open door, he spies an empty office -- through the window the tarmac are a few MILITARY VEHICLES, a handful of airm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I going in alone or are y--?

dialogues.text: SLAM-FLATTENED BY JACK, who KNEELS to him. PUSH IN CLOSE his eyes wide, mind racing -- WHAT THE HELL NEXT? CUT TO: 89.

dialogues.text: BEHIND A SOLDIER as he RUNS through the dark building -- shit -- he comes to a stop, back against the wall -- but IN on his face: IT'S JACK, IN AN AIR FORCE UNIFORM. He is fucking scared; at least he's holding a rifle. He peels around a corner -- through a window, the tarmac: GUARDS, VEHICLES. Jack's eyes shift -- he spots an AIRCRAFT FUEL TANK. Eyes wild -- A METALLIC CLI-CHUNK AS HE UNSAFETIES

dialogues.text: A SOLDIER crosses to a vehicle, on his radio when KAFA- BOOOOOM! The FUEL TANK EXPLODES, A MASSIVE BLAST! The air take cover, RUN TO MOVE NEARBY VEHICLES, GENERAL MAYHEM - and our CAMERA BOOMS UP -- to the MILITARY JEEP THAT DRIV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Dr. Woodward was dishonorably discharged from Nellis Air Base in 1963 because of "subversive conduct," whatever that is. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back when he was like Middle-Aged Man Woodward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He's been tracking this thing since like 1958.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the movie) What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It says April 8th, 1963 incident. I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary, we got to find this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: subterranean. He's being -- subterranean -- treated without compassion or respect....

dialogues.text: LIVING," "RESTRAINTS USED," "EXPERIMENTS CONDUCTED" -- as Charles threads a FILM:

dialogues.speaker: DR. WOODWARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- I explained that all he wants is to rebuild his ship.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WOODWARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A craft made up of those cubes of a complex, shape-shifting element-- remarkable material that we'll never fully understand. He has been desperate to reconstitute his ship since it crashed here in `58, but instead of giving him the help he needs, we've held him as a prisoner. He's been restrained and experimented upon -- Through pain and lack of compassion, we have taught him to hate us all. We've turned him into an enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientist explaining something to a group of SENIOR OFFIC Among them, a 32-year-old NELEC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Film JUMP CUTS to a HUGE REINFORCED LAB CAGE. Inside, sit almost in a ball, IS THE MASSIVE CREATURE. Hard to see he Another JUMP CUT as a SOLDIER offers a bucket of FOOD to alien -- IT'S WOODWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, it's Dr. Woodward. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodward offers what looks like RAW MEAT to the motionles sitting CREATURE. All the boys watch quietly -- then, suddenly, in milliseconds, the creature is UP, GRABBING WOODWARD THROUGH THE BARS -- the boys JUMP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arh! I can't watch that!

dialogues.speaker: DR. WOODWARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I told them I knew these things because he made contact with me. That he makes a psychic connection by touch. The moment we made contact, I understood him and he, me. What I know is that if we don't change this and start helping him, we will all pay the price. But Nelec won't listen--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are SCARED as they watch the creature HOLD WOODW TIGHT -- LIFT HIM -- and its TENTACLES suddenly THRUST in his NOSE, EARS and MOUTH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stands and looks intently at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodward wasn't trying to kill it. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was trying to help it escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a MUFFLED SHATTER-CRASH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DON'T KILL US! PLEASE DON'T (calls on radio) KILL US!!! PLEASE DON'T KILL -- we've got civilians -- US!!! minors-- four of `em.

dialogues.text: The locker hallway: the Boys are HANDCUFFED AND SCARED, b led out by ARMED SOLDIERS. Nelec moves to them. QUIETLY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... oh shit...

dialogues.text: Where the hell you been? What are

dialogues.text: -- yessir -- (holds the SUPER 8 FILM) But you should look at this first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
