dialogues.text: Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctant as hell, for a tense beat, the Driver pulls the controls: the door HISSES LOUDLY as it opens. 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back, the boys are all frozen for a moment, watchi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overmyer moves for the door. Five feet away from the door stops, turns back to Nelec:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anywhere in particul--

dialogues.speaker: KKKKRRRRRASSHHH
dialogues.text: -- the Driver SCREAMS -- the thing GRABS OVERMYER, who DR THE RIFLE -- IT FIRES -- the projectile HITS THE SAFETY G

dialogues.speaker: DOES NOTHING
dialogues.text: Joe IN SHOCK -- Behind him, Martin VOMITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of firepower do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLES SCRAMBLES to unlatch his seatbelt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles! Maybe you should wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAAAM!!! The bus is SLAMMED SO HARD --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUS IS PUSHED TWENTY FEET FROM SOMETHING ON THE OTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windows SHATTER -- Charles and Cary -- seatbelts removed LAND ON JOE AND MARTIN! The THREE SOLDIERS hit the window floor painfully -- Hernandez so hard he's INSTANTLY

dialogues.speaker: UNCONSCIOUS
dialogues.text: UP. Nelec rises. Scared, but pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REAR WHEELS of the bus SCREAM in rotation -- we COUNTERMOVE with the creature as it COMES AROUND the othe side, CLIMBS onto the exposed side -- METAL AND WINDOW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys gather their wits -- LIGHTS FLASHING HAUNTINGLY 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you guys okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I wanna go home so bad --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe moves to the locked bulletproof glass door -- tries t handle -- but it's never gonna open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the OTHER side of the glass, Nelec rights himself, momentarily disoriented -- breathing heavily, he moves aw from the bus door to the locked glass separating him from kids; he tries the handle, but it won't open for him eith

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there is Joe and Nelec, face-to-face -- Joe seeing th fear in Nelec's eyes -- his understanding that this is hi fate. Somehow Nelec takes this moment to look into Joe's -- to silently -- in a look -- repent. Instantly, Joe kno he's about to watch this man's life end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH! Nelec turns -- the creature is BUSTING the bus doo SMASHING AT IT -- to make it BIGGER. So it can get inside The Driver's LEG IS CAUGHT -- he's trying to get out, but cannot -- is PANICKING -- as SSSSTAB!!! The creature KILL HIM INSTANTLY and SMASH as again it tries to WIDEN the do Nelec WINCES -- the only conscious man on this side of th glass; the boys COWER on their side, with each monstrous all their eyes on Nelec -- except Joe, who only wants to to Alice. He sees the SHATTERED BULLETPROOF WINDOW -- abo them, on what has become the "roof" of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there, there's broken glass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- here, use me, I'm strong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme get on your shoulders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm strong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys struggle to get Joe onto Martin's shoulders as, the other side of the glass, Nelec scrambles for Hernande fallen SEMI-AUTO RIFLE. He grabs it and scampers back to glass as SMASH!!! Pieces of metal and glass BURST like ic chips as the creature violently WIDENS the bus door openi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Charles' shoulders, Joe can reach the shattered-but-th window -- which he must HIT -- BREAK OPEN to get out -- essentially exactly what the creature is doing, in revers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using both fists, Joe POUNDS the window. No give. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harder! Come on, you PUSSY!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all his might, Joe hits the window again -- the SLIGHTEST sound of glass adjusting -- meanwhile, SLAM!!! creature BUSTING the bus door -- PRYING it wider like a sardine can -- NELEC SITS AGAINST THE GLASS AND OPENS FIR FUTILELY, ON THE CREATURE. He makes a CALL on his walkie:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Nelec -- use the big guns. Whatever happens to me, you take it down, you kill him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and he drops the walkie and FIRES AGAIN -- the LOUD GUNFIRE BARELY AUDIBLE behind the glass with the boys as hits the glass again -- BAM -- a CRINKLING of glass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe hits again -- so does the creature -- as Nelec RUNS O OF AMMO. That was never really hope anyway. Joe hits agai and CRASH! The window SHATTERS! Glass chunks RAIN DOWN on boys -- all covering their face -- Cary seeing the CREATU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Joe, move!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the boys helping, Joe pulls himself up -- outsid the bus, Joe peeks out -- the fucking creature -- its bac Joe -- just fifteen feet away, focused on the door -- and strains to climb out here, onto the top-side of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as the boys climb out, the creature climbs in -- firs Joe, then Charles (AD LIB DIALOGUE WITH CARY AND MARTIN: gotta lose some weight --" "I know!!!"), Then Cary, and Martin last -- they all jump down to the dirt -- they hea SCREAMS and turn back for a moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the bus, Nelec watches as the creature ENTERS THE

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT-FITTING BUS, SMASHING BENCHES, MAKING ITS WAY
dialogues.text: TERRIFYINGLY DOWN THE AISLE TOWARD HIM. And as the creatu descends upon him, in the silence before the final lunge Nelec says, eerily quietly, terrified:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it was my turn once... to find you. Now... it's your t-- 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can finish, the creature fucking ATTACKS -- and would be horrible and brutal, if the BLOOD DIDN'T SPRAY U

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the field, a distance away, the boys watch the bus SHU and SHAKE. Then... silence. They see the creature burst o of the bus -- then RUN OFF -- fast and stealthy, away fro them in the overgrown grass, like a native hunter. Which, course, is partly what it is. They're sort of stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just sharteezed a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis stares off, lost. Two AIR FORCE SOLDIERS arrive:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to come with us, we have some questions for you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what, is she... Is she dead--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just come with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing is hard for heartsick Louis, his legs so hurt -- suddenly JACK IS THERE, acting the role of Air Force:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey fellas, I've got orders from Colonel Nelec to personally transport this man to base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all yours, Staff Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the two Soldiers head off, Jack wraps Louis' arm over shoulders, heads off in the other direction, as Louis loo him over, confused:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're we going--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- to find our kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On LOUIS' FACE -- a surprised glimmer of HOPE -- 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments later, TIGHT on a POCKET -- Joe pulls out his MOTHER'S NECKLACE. WIDEN to see that he's taken the neckl from Overmyer's dead body. Cary holds up his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got my fireworks back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (who gives a shit) Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn: a car comes, fast -- PUSH IN ON JOE who studie the oncoming car, as behind him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming, man! I think we should go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--!!! No, look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car ARRIVES: It's DONNY. He gets out of his car, wild and red-eyed, incredibly happy to see them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho ho!!! You dorks are alive! I didn't know...! (finally sees the bus) ... what the FUCK?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get back to town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hop in, man! But you should know: I am massively stoned right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny looks at Joe, like it hurts to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Catalina cruises fast through the deserted neighborho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe drives, Donny is ASLEEP. Other boys in the back. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw something at the cemetery. Woodward said it's subterranean-- I think I know where it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? What are those sounds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, that sounds like guns!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to a tank) What the hell is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY, BOOM!!! A DEAFENING, CONCUSSIVE GUNBLAST! They' LIT UP by what they see ahead: in the oncoming cross-stre

dialogues.speaker: TANKS
dialogues.text: AGAIN AND AGAIN AT SOMETHING WE CAN'T YET SEE! The boys C THEIR EARS -- Donny awakens, but only for a moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe quickly turns left into a driveway -- but we PUSH IN TIGHT ON HIM -- from the direction they just came are MOR TANKS AND MILITARY VEHICLES -- Joe's eyes go wide -- they stuck. GUNFIRE CONTINUES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go by foot--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just follow me! (nudges Donny hard)) Donny! Hey! Donny, wake up! (Donny half looks at him) We have to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too stoned!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugs are so bad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and the boys get out of the car fast and RUN across t street, zig-zagging between the enormous MILITARY VEHICLE 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the weapons are misfiring! Surface to air, radar -- all of them! It's a mess out here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldier hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe in the lead - they turn and look back -- a massive sh of the neighborhood under fire -- houses getting BLOWN TO SHIT in collateral damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EXPLOSION HITS TOO CLOSE -- the boys SCREAM as they ru BETWEEN HOUSES -- and WE TRACK WITH THEM -- four boys rac through a neighborhood under siege -- power GOES OUT -- a some explosions are much closer than others -- another BI HIT and they go to a back door of a house -- and go insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- they run in for cover -- they're silhouetted in this d space by the EXPLOSION LIGHT emanating from the windows. They're all out of breath in a strange KITCHEN --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys see those explosions? They were huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- whose house is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he hands him a picture) Kathy's. I got it off the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy? Oh, Kathy's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another CRAZY LOUD AND BRIGHT EXPLOSION -- the light fixt sway. Charles grabs a coke on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Charles-- that's not yours-- -- what?! I'm thirsty and I' in a war zone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another fucking LOUD BLAST -- sound of GLASS BREAKING -- the creature ROARING -- 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there it is, in silhouette, moving past the bay windo Joe realizes: where the creature is, so are the blasts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, guys, let's go. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe runs -- the others follow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the cemetery--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as they get to the living room a HUGE EXPLOSION BLOWS A WALL! They all go down -- but Martin is in agony all of sudden -- his leg RIPPED by concrete. If there's good new here, the creature has left this area -- the explosions getting further away. But there's blood and Martin is in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to my leg? It hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, Martin, you gotta bone sticking out of your leg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hole in the house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, gimme that thing on the curtains!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles wants the tie around the curtains, still hanging the wall that now has a HOLE in it; MILITARY VEHICLES can seen driving past outside. Joe hands Charles the thick fa tie -- which Charles fashion into a tourniquet, wraps it around Martin's leg, tight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go find Alice-- you have to stay with Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles looks at Martin -- can't argue. Says, sincerely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you gonna be okay without me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a meaningful beat) ... yeah. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles nods -- Joe looks to Cary:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not staying with the girls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Cary. Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my leg hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Cary, we gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe nods, determined, and he and Cary head off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't even done it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Cary run through the semi-demolished neighborhood many houses shattered, some cars obliterated. The only lo figures in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Cary stop, out of breath, at the graves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been following you for the last five blocks. What are we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Cary run through the graveyard and over to the CARETAKER'S SHED. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're out of breath -- they try ONE garage door, window CAKED WITH DIRT. Stuck. The SECOND door. Dirt-caked windo Stuck. The third is a barn door -- they try it: locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help you with what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? What's in these windows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary, help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dirt. Why is there dirt in these windows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, on three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, three.... One, two, three.... One, two threee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two begin KICKING the door together -- on three -- on two -- CRASH! Again and again, until finally the door KIC OPEN -- and they almost FALL INSIDE -- and thank goodness they didn't -- because -- and now we're looking STRAIGHT FROM INSIDE THE SHED -- the entire floor of the shed has DUG OUT -- DROPPING FORTY FEET STRAIGHT DOWN, dirt PILED, caked along the sides of the structure. The boys catch th breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. This is scary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any sparklers in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary opens his backpack, whips out a Fourth of July SPARK LIGHTS it with a lighter and DROPS IT IN. The thing falls enough to tell them it's too far to jump. 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But burning on the dirt floor of the nearly-dug hole, it lights up a TUNNEL at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Alice is down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JEEP roars past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack drives fast. Louis sits beside him. It's awkward. Bu not angry. Finally, vulnerable, scared and sad:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to your house that day. To tell you that I never meant to hurt anyone. Swear to God. (beat, respectful tears) I'm sorry, Jack. About what happened to your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack looks at him for a moment, then back to the road. A beat. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... It was an accident. It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack glances at him. A small nod of forgiveness and gratitude. Louis wants to cry again, but just accepts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe begins CLIMBING DOWN the ROPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe lands on the bottom. Dark as hell -- looks up -- at C climbing down into the hole -- the barn roof looming abov him. Now Cry lands too. There are THREE POSSIBLE WAYS TO Joe's mind races about which way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, I don't understand--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR a DISTANT RUMBLING -- like something far off, but MECHANICAL. Then: 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin their walk into the dirt tunnel, a TALL OVAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're SO FAR AWAY, that the screen is mostly black, with small speck of SPARKLY LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to an area LITTERED WITH THE STUFF OF A LIVING ROOM. They look up: ANOTHER HOLE LEADING DOWN, DUG STRAIG THROUGH A HOUSE. They continue, coming to an INTERSECTION where a NEW TUNNEL branches off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's DIM LIGHT from up ahead, where the tunnel BENDS. RUMBLING/MECHANICAL SOUND LOUDER now. Joe and Cary slowly move forward -- seeing something off-camera that scares a amazes them all at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cross to the other side. Cary bumps into a HANGING SHERIFF PRUITT. Cary is about to scream, but Joe puts a h on his mouth and leads him away from Pruitt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sheriff Pruitt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Cary look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makeshift HANGING BULBS provide some light; a number of o TUNNELS are visible from here, too. Joe and Cary look at space in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're under the water tower. 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Joe sees something that makes him grab at Cary's shi Cary looks: THROUGH THE MASS OF METAL AND MACHINERY AND

dialogues.speaker: AND IT'S SAVAGELY EATING SOMETHING. IT MOVES A BIT
dialogues.text: IT'S A HUMAN LEG. Joe and Cary would SCREAM if they didn' need to stay quiet. In a panicked WHISPER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's eating a person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe moves away from Cary to get a better view of the othe side of the machinery -- and there he sees, in an INSET section of the rock-wall, THREE HUMAN BODIES, HANGING

dialogues.speaker: LIFELESS FROM THEIR FEET, WRAPPED IN SOME KIND OF THIN
dialogues.text: SHELLAC. TIGHT ON JOE as he sees, among them, ALICE. His heart POUNDS, his resolve quadruples. Cary sees her too -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's here. We're going to use your firecrackers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's going to hurt it, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are other tunnels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to make noise. Lots of it, right here, in two minutes. Make it loud and make it last-- gimme some sparklers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goes through his bag) -- why-- what are you gonna do--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes SPARKLERS and a LIGHTER from Cary) Make sure you're gone by the time it blows: you can't be here, you gotta run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Joe's already gone. Stay with Cary, who opens his backpack, starts pulling out his amazing array of EXPLOSI glancing up to make sure he's out of the creature's view

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE FAST with Joe as he races, a LIT SPARKLER giving him light -- the MECHANICAL RUMBLING all but gone now. Joe ru looking for another way into the creature's massive space he finally finds another INTERSECTION -- he turns into it he disappears down the tunnel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary's made a long, insane pile of FIRECRACKERS -- he use OPEN M-80 and begins laying a SQUIGGLY, LONG LINE OF GUN POWDER back, away from the firecrackers -- away from the entrance to the creature's CONTRAPTION space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe races down the dirt tunnel, the SOUND OF THE MECHANIC RUMBLING -- and its INCREASING PITCH -- getting LOUDER. T SPARKLER DIES as LIGHT BEGINS TO REVEAL JOE, who slows -- peers around the dirt tunnel bend -- he is now on the OTH SIDE of the space. He sees the creature -- then looks acr to the lifeless body of Alice. His heart sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary's done laying out the charges -- he pulls out his lighter -- FFFT! FFFT! The damn thing won't light --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- come on-- damnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FFT! FFT! No go -- he keeps trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe watches as the creature FINISHES WITH ITS MEAL AND HE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Cary, come on, come on-- 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cary frantically trying the lighter -- FFT! FFT! FFT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- damnit!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up -- watches the creature GRAB AND PULL ALICE'S LIFELESS BODY DOWN FROM HER HANGING POSITION -- it moves her to where he was eating the teacher -- Cary SHAKES THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature PULLS AWAY the fibrous covering over Alice - its TENTACLES SLITHER OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching this is horror, Joe's about to run in just as BABABABABABABABAM!!! The creature JERKS UP from its almos meal of Alice, looks toward the EXPLOSIVE SOUNDS, then LE HER, quickly moving for the tunnel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature arrives in the SMOKE-FILLED TUNNEL, as the FIREWORKS FILL the tunnel with BRIGHT, MULTI-COLORED LIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe SPRINTS in, gets to Alice -- lightly slaps her face -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Alice, please -- please -- (nothing -- SLAP) Alice, wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing -- so he fucking SLAPS HER FACE HARD and she sudd INHALES SHARPLY, he eyes WIDE, terrified --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice! You're alive! Can you hear me? Are you okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's CATCHING HER BREATH, nodding, looking at him, amaze 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just-- doing the best I can to save you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She GRABS HIM AND HUGS HIM TIGHT, teary and grateful -- during which -- quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad. He told me. He was worried. And flipping out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we need to move--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she breaks out of the hug and grabs his shirt, intens

dialogues.speaker: TINA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINA, a 24-year-old , disoriented woman with curlers in h hair, wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Alice have helped down one FAMILIAR FACE: SHERIFF PRUITT. They're out of breath, but their survival instinc has kicked in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left my bag in my car. Then I went to my car to get my bag--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been experimented on for years. It's terrified and exhausted and hungry, it just wants to go home. When it touched me, I knew -- 116.
